title: Suitable font for 1920's Charleston poster
content:
Hey!  
I need some help with a poster I’m doing at typography, uni. I’m supposed to create a poster from 1920’s about a Jazz/Charleston dance festival. It’s about making people of today getting involved and passionated.

So I’m looking for a good font that might be from that era or maybe inspired from it. Also if anyone’s good with coming up with names, I would be very pleased with name suggestions of this festival.

Thanks!!

/Anna Maria

 [‹ constructing tangent in Illustrator (geometric glyphs)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45417 "Go to previous forum topic") [Building Signage to "Match" with Historical Lettering ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45293 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lilybeach

comments.content:
Lily  
if you try this website I’m sure you’ll find something appropriate.

[http://www.specialtyfonts.com/deco/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.specialtyfonts.com/deco/index.htm "http://www.specialtyfonts.com/deco/index.htm")

JH

I would try these;

Neutraface (especially the display styles)  
 [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=18&subpage=viewfonts")

Kabel (not the ITC Version!)  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kabel&x=25&y=9](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kabel&x=25&y=9 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kabel&x=25&y=9")

Houschka Rounded (for a new flavour)  
 [http://typophile.com/node/45126](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/typophile.com/node/45126 "http://typophile.com/node/45126")

You might also look here for more background.

[http://www.geocities.com/flapper\_culture/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192904/http:/www.geocities.com/flapper_culture/ "http://www.geocities.com/flapper\_culture/")

ChrisL
